attributes.action: Impose sanctions on Trump and his cabinet if they withdraw from or ignore COP21.
attributes.background: Individuals in the current US administration have in the past shown disregard for scientific data on climate change and are signaling they might not follow on US commitments taken at the COP21 agreement. The UK should consider putting such individuals on the list of financial sanctions target.

attributes.action: Ban Zero-Hour Contract
attributes.background: Zero-hour contracts are making life harder for everyone facing it. The employee does not have any guaranteed working hours. This, in its turn, leads to the risk of being homeless and poor. A lot of people are struggling to get a property to live because nobody wants to deal with 0-hour workers.
attributes.additional_details:
People are also struggling to feed their family while, in fact, they work hard to survive. I am asking to ban Zero-hour contracts and follow the example of countries, like New Zeland. Every hard-working person should have the same working rights and be able to rent a property, apply for mortgage and a lot more.
 
Please sign this petition to help make people's life a little bit better.

Thank you for your time!

attributes.action: Hold a general election as so we can vote on the policies of Brexit.
attributes.background: We are facing Brexit whether you voted for it or not. Now we need to vote on the terms of the Brexit. An unelected leader should not lead the Brexit negations.
attributes.additional_details:
A general election should be held to allow our parties to form their plan for Brexit allowing the electorate to have a say with the power of a vote. 

An unelected leader is not the right person for the job.

attributes.action: call for uk prime minister may, to go to parliament & answers for NHS crisis
attributes.background: The British people deserve answers on why our country's greatest asset the NHS is turning the British people away & or leaving them to die in corridors, & it takes Red Cross to call you out don't cut staff & budgets, sort this its our human rights, Pm & government it's your fault not anyone else's
attributes.additional_details: Please sign this petition for prime minister Theresa May to go to parliament and give answer to the British tax payer and it's people this is a disgrace people are dieing, needlessly under your power and government you have a lot of questions to answer, and don't blame the British public or the staff nurses or doctors, you have made the cuts to staff and hospitals budgets. please get this petition as far as we can as a great country, we're living in 3rd world conditions it's a disgrace. Fund NHS

attributes.action: Improve the quality and amount of PE in schools and spend more on school dinners
attributes.background: We are a group of Year 10 students at Greenwood Academy in Birmingham. We are campaigning to increase the amount of PE lessons in school and improve the quality of them in order to help get students healthier. We also feel school dinners lack the nutrition necessary to have healthier young people.

attributes.action: To invest money in local government so they can support homeless shelters.
attributes.background: We are a group of Year 10 students from Greenwood Academy in Birmingham studying GCSE Citizenship. For a campaign we feel in our local area that there is not enough support given to aid local government in building more homeless shelters and provide assistance to those who need it.

attributes.action: Ban smoking in all public places in the UK
attributes.background:
Why are we still breathing in smoke that we know will kill us, even when we've chosen not to?
Those of us who have decided not to smoke, or to give up, are still forced to inhale cigarette smoke every time we go for a walk or take our children to the park or pop to the shops! It's not right!
attributes.additional_details:
Smoking is the primary cause of preventable illness and premature death, accounting for approximately 96,000 deaths a year in the United Kingdom.

Smoking harms nearly every organ of the body and dramatically reduces both quality of life and life expectancy.

The 2010 US Surgeon General report, ‘How Tobacco Smoke Causes Disease’, concludes that “there is no risk-free level of exposure to tobacco smoke, and there is no safe tobacco product".

attributes.action: UK Government to hand control of the Severn bridges to the Welsh Assembly.
attributes.background: Control of the Severn bridges needs to be handed to the Welsh Assembly, who have unanomously voted to abolish the tolls. This would greatly help the Welsh economy.

attributes.action: Assure that the Banbury Horton General Hospital stays open as Oxford is too far!
attributes.background: In writing this as a ambulance practitioner I am solely concerned with patients care as for a seriously ill patient or one in cardiac arrest yo be conveyed from Banbury and surrounding area all the way to Oxford would assuredly kill them we must protect Horton Hospital as a local Banbury resource!!!
attributes.additional_details: See NHS statistics and the resuscitation councils standards for early access in cardiac arrest and cardiac event cases and or cva's/stroke victims time every single second counts

attributes.action: Parliamentary Election To Take Place 3 Months After Brexit.
attributes.background: Brexit has had huge impact not only on the economy, but has been divisive to the nation/s... for many people both brexiteers and remainers many have lost a lot of faith in the government ability and do not feel the government can take us forward to unite us and recover the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Since Brexit, the countries division has been deep routed... And many people feel like their voices are not being heard. The government has been acting unilaterally ignoring a significant number of the population.

This has left very little confidence in the government's ability to fairly treat it's citizens. 

And the only way our voices will be heard is by holding a general election, to lead us in a positive direction and change.

attributes.action: Terminate the tax free benefits enjoyed by religious institutions.
attributes.background:
Churches, mosques and synagogues don't pay any tax on earnings or land owned, yet they often preach about social responsibility.
To really help the local communities in which they thrive they should give something back in the form of taxes.
attributes.additional_details:
In light of the fact we are rapidly moving toward a more secular society, why should we still be subsidising religion via tax exemption?
The church often takes a political stance during times of crisis. Most recently the humanitarian disaster that is the refugee exodus, has the church not got a moral responsibility to contribute some of its vast wealth? Now lets make it a legal one too.

attributes.action: Prioritise implementation of the alternative student finance product
attributes.background: Many Muslims are unable to attend university, because their faith prohibits them from taking interest based loans to fund tuition fees.The government has acknowledged this and have developed an alternative financing model.This needs to be made available so that more students can attend university
attributes.additional_details:
Links to previous developments;

2014 consultation
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/349899/bis-14-984-government-response-to-a-consultation-on-a-sharia-compliant-alternative-finance-product.pdf

White Paper 2016
Page 56- Alternative student finance offer
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/523546/bis-16-265-success-as-a-knowledge-economy-web.pdf

For information on developments visit
http://www.halalstudentloans.co.uk/

attributes.action: All PMs must state that their duty is to enact the will of the people, not God.
attributes.background: All incoming PMs should be required to publicly confirm that their primary duty is to the electorate and to reaffirm their commitment to their election manifesto.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is not an attack on the right of acting MPs to hold personal religious beliefs. Rather, it is intended to remind our leaders that, in their public capacity, they are ultimately answerable to the electorate and that the manifesto commitments they've made to voters supersede the demands of their personal faith.

attributes.action: Create a report on cannabis legalisation worldwide
attributes.background:
Cannabis is being legalised and regulated worldwide, for recreational and medicinal use.

We need a full, detailed report which uses up to date science on any health benefits from cannabis and that also looks at the varying models of regulation of cannabis worldwide.

attributes.action: Owners of UK newspapers must be British citizens
attributes.background: Newspapers have enormous influence in UK politics, but the biggest of them are not owned by British citizens. They have power without being real stakeholders in society.  Those seeking to influence UK politics and opinion should actually be citizens who will have to live with the results.

attributes.action: Ban vehicles greater than 7.5 tonnes from UK roads except between 8pm & 8am
attributes.background: The UK has a problem with its ageing road infrastructure that simply cannot cope with the volume of traffic that uses it on a daily basis. The volume of road traffic needs to be spread out across a 24 hour period, lorries greater than 7.5 tonnes should only be permitted to travel between 8pm and 8am
attributes.additional_details: The average daily commute has just increased to 2 hours and the general public is being forced to spend wholly unacceptable amounts of time in cars for what are often small journeys. Forcing drivers off the road through increased taxes or toll roads is not the answer. The answer is obvious but the government won't take the action required to tackle the problem. Road traffic needs to be spread out over the 24 hour period and allow vehicles greater than 7.5 tonnes to only travel between 8pm - 8am

attributes.action: make all care/rest homes have a percentage of locally funded beds
attributes.background: Why should the elderly have to lose all their money, sell their property to pay for their care when they have to go into a care/residential home? Then when the money runs out, they have to move on?
attributes.additional_details: Care homes/Residential homes charge an extorionate rate for the care they provide, ranging from £800 to £1000+ per week. Some places are locally funded, whilst others are privately funded, meaning the person living there has to pay full price, for the care they receive. Locally funded places, will take into account someones pension, and will only pay some of the cost,leaving the person very little "pocket money". But atleast they have some money! All care homes/Residential homes, should allow for the fact that someones money will run out eventually and should make provisions for this, allowing the elderly person to go over to locally funded monies, without moving them on,so the elderly person, will be secure in the place they live, to live outtheir final days.

attributes.action: Put FEMINISM WEEK on the National Curriculum: female role models in all subjects
attributes.background: As a fully qualified teacher I know first hand that some schools rarely teach about feminism at all. For just one week of the academic year, if we could teach not just the history of feminism, but celebrate the achievements of females today in every subject, we could inspire true equality in the U.K
attributes.additional_details:
Feminism is already on the rise: our education system should be at the forefront of the movement. Not just #heforshe and #equalpay trending on Twitter; but opening the minds of all students male, female and LGTBQ to believe in total equality for their generation, both at home and in the work place - so no matter what gender you are born, you can dream just as big, and command the same respect.

I am aware that teachers have to cover what is on the exams but one week will not interfere too much.

attributes.action: Help release Iranian prisoner of conscience kept in solitary confinement 6 years
attributes.background: I am a student of Mohammad Ali Taheri and I was arrested in Iran in a peaceful demonstration in protest to his death sentence (UN Special Reporter March 2016 report: https://goo.gl/WWhzjPTo ). I have been campaigning for him for several years and I need the UK government's help to free him.
attributes.additional_details:
** http://www.auswaertiges-amt.de/DE/Infoservice/Presse/Meldungen/2016/161108-MRHH-Mohammad_Ali_Taheri.html?version=2
 
** https://www.gruene-bundestag.de/presse/pressemitteilungen/2016/november/iran-freiheit-fuer-mohammad-ali-taheri-15-11-2016.html
 
** http://shaheedoniran.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/SG-Report-UNGA2016.pdf

**http://www.petertatchellfoundation.org/tag/dr-taheri/

**https://www.amnesty.org.uk/blogs/urgent-action-network/my-teacher-needs-your-urgent-help

attributes.action: Stop parking charges at hospitals for visitors & staff, charges for TV & phone
attributes.background: I have been in hospital several times, cost £1.60 per hr, £7.50 per day for TV, 3 minute phone call cost £2.00. I am an OAP and cannot afford these prices.
attributes.additional_details: Being old I am in and out of hospital

attributes.action: Ensure every UK home and business has access to a minimum of 2mb broadband.
attributes.background: All UK homes and businesses need access to a minimum 2mb broadband connection in order to benefit from the increasingly digital world. This should be universally completed, at no extra cost to customers, regardless of location and challenges, before any roll out of further improvements elsewhere.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government must introduce legislation to make this a minimum standard for all internet providers to meet.

attributes.action: Never sign a trade deal like CETA/TTIP which cede UK sovereignty to corporations
attributes.background: Once Brexit has completed, the UK will be able to enter into trade deals by itself. Ministerial support for TTIP/CETA which are aimed at eroding national sovereignty and giving multinational corporations the right to sue governments if policy adversely effects their profits is a serious danger.
attributes.additional_details: The main tenet of the Brexit campaign was to "take back control" from the EU. UK ministers have voiced strong support for CETA/TTIP which seems contradictory given that such trade deals put the sovereignty of government in doubt and give corporations the ability to sue governments under Investor-State Dispute Settlement powers before special international tribunals. This would effectively bring an end to the cherished principle of equality before the law, all in the name of greater profits.

attributes.action: Legalise the possesion and use of tasers within the security industry.
attributes.background: In the security industry there are certain situations where security staff are unable protect themselves, Innocent bystanders, Assets. Due to individuals being agressive who cant be controlled by using conventional methods or a indavidual with a weapon, Bladed article or a possible firearm etc.
attributes.additional_details:
Each year there is numerous deaths and assaults within the security industry, Which could of been avoided with the use of a taser.

We understand that the use of a taser would be the very last resort. However we believe tasers would prevent such agression just by being a visual deterrent.
Monitoring tasers:
Anyone possesing a taser would need adequate training.
Body cameras to be used in conjuction with tasers to show taser was correctly drawn/used.

Police are the front line but so are we.

attributes.action: Special funding to Councils for social housing for adults with disabilities
attributes.background: Many local authorities have social housing problems... but more so for adults with physical disabilities and/or learning disabilities (who may require shared living). Where housing associations have stepped in to provide properties they charge rents far beyond what is affordable on housing benefit.
attributes.additional_details: Many social housing properties are in disadvantaged areas with high crime, making them unsafe for many adults with learning disabilities, or properties are ill suited for the person's physical disabilities... this results in many people having to continue living wth parents long into adulthood... with complex care needs that place unsustainable pressure on the family relationship increasing the risk of crisis or carer breakdown.

attributes.action: issue an apology  to homosexuals who were criminalised  under indecency laws
attributes.background: Lives have been ruined, aspirations destroyed by cruel laws , in the armed forces men were unjustly punished for the crime of falling in love with another man,blacklisted as sex offenders a status that for years hung like a shadow , causing pain ,hurt ,mental health issues and astricisation

attributes.action: Reduce TV License Fee for full time students living away from home.
attributes.background: Recent introduction of full TV license for students living away from home, even for iPlayer is nonsensical as it will be ignored, not paid and cannot be policed.  A more pragmatic approach would be to have a nominal fee (eg £10) where students can provide parental details of cover at home address.

attributes.action: Stop advancement of religion being considered a charitable purpose.
attributes.background: The law recognises the advancement of religion as a charitable purpose. Religion includes all faiths and none  it includes a religion that does not have a belief in God. Advancing any belief system alone should not be considered charitable activity.
attributes.additional_details: Some belief systems may help people but assessing whether the beliefs themselves achieve benefit is subjective.  Public money through gift aid should not be available for this. Religious organisations should have to show other public benefit to qualify as charity and should only be allowed to use public money for that other purpose.

attributes.action: Stop the  plans, to use the hard shoulder on motorways, as an additional lane.
attributes.background: The plans to use the hard shoulder, on motorways, as an additional lane, is ill conceived and very dangerous. The hard shoulder is an EMERGENCY lane and should be kept as such. The emergency  and breakdown services will not be able to help drivers in the event of an accident or breakdown.
attributes.additional_details: I believe the emergency/breakdown services and motoring organisations, have already expressed their concern.

attributes.action: End disability discrimination through Essential Criteria for Driving Licences.
attributes.background: At present, there is no law preventing a role where the primary function is as a driver, or in the Emergency and Armed Services, to be distinct from a role requiring travel, both having an "Essential Criteria" for a "Full UK Driving licence", thus allowing for selective discrimination of disability.
attributes.additional_details:
Roles that require travel such as the following: 
https://roles.mariecurie.org.uk/VacancyInformation.aspx?VId=58439
are discriminating against disabilities whose condition affect their eligibility to drive.
While there are professions, that should be exempt, such as roles where the primary function is driving, or in Emergency and Armed Services roles, we ask parliament for roles outside these selected professions to apply to be able to list a "UK Driving Licence" as an "essential job criteria".

attributes.action: Give retired police officers the authority to charge drivers using mobile phone
attributes.background: I spoke about this to a retired police inspector who thought it was a good idea , maybe they could get a part of the fine for there time taken to charge the person with the offence

attributes.action: Hinckley power station should be funded by the UK.
attributes.background: The country is asking foreign powers to provide and control our nuclear power. The rates of interest on the money put up is 9% and the guaranteed rate for electricity produced is such that we will suffer  from higher energy prices.
attributes.additional_details: Savers cannot obtain virtually any interest on their savings. They should be offered the opportunity of funding the project secured by the government at a rate of half that demanded by the French and Chinese. This would nevertheless allow them to invest in a project needed by the country but offering them  a reasonable return on their capital.

attributes.action: Increase wage for qualified level 3 nursery assistants and early years educators
attributes.background: Nursery assistants and early years educators follow the same EYFS targets as a reception class teacher. We are now required to have specified knowledge of children's learning and development. It is no longer 'just' childcare. We are teachers.
attributes.additional_details: Nursery Assistants and early years educators perform a similar job to that of a reception class teacher. We must ensure children are learning and developing at a rate deemed age appropriate. We must carry out rergular assessments on the children, and facilitate learning environments and activities based on each individual childs needs. We need to have in depth knowledge of the Early Years Foundation Stage and are usually required to be qualified.

attributes.action: Enable Police and Telephone services to trace and prosecute cold callers.
attributes.background: Cold calling is supposed to be illegal, TPS is not a deterrent, so the Police, trading Standards and Telephone service providers should be compelled to cooperate to trace, arrest, and prosecute offenders. A help line should be created for reporting offending numbers.
attributes.additional_details: In this digital world, it should be possible to trace who purchased any number. Citizens can bar withheld numbers to prevent some calls, but there is a problem with normal numbers. These must be held on record by service providers. They must be traceable to a specific location.

attributes.action: Bring in a law to stop any more buildings over 30 floors being built in London.
attributes.background: London isn't Manhattan. Our original environment is dwarfed by mega-towers that no-one lives in. Let's ask the Government to bring in planning law to prevent any more towers over 30 floors being built in Central London. Those extra floors aren't solving any housing crisis - just overseas investors
attributes.additional_details:
Guardian article on 50 story St George's Wharf tower - the blight of Vauxhall riverside: 
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/may/24/revealed-foreign-buyers-own-two-thirds-of-tower-st-george-wharf-london
This Ipsos mori survey for Skyline Campaign suggests that lots of people agree with me: 
http://workplaceinsight.net/majority-of-londoners-support-greater-restrictions-on-new-tall-buildings/

attributes.action: Introduce Mobile phone jammers into prisons to stop prisoners taunting victims
attributes.background: There has been an increase in prisoners taunting victims, intimidating witnesses and accessing social media. Introducing mobile phone jammers into prisons would rectify this with the flick of a button.
attributes.additional_details: The Secretary of state for justice needs to introduce Mobile phone jammers which would stop all prisoners accessing the internet via smart phones and making calls.

attributes.action: To reduce fraud, Banks must match Name to the A/C No. before Auth. transactions!
attributes.background: Currently UK banks only check if the sort code and account number is correct before a transaction is authorised. This opens vulnerabilities for fraudsters to exploit the system. In some other countries, if the name does not match the account then the transaction is rejected.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government must make this a statutory requirement.

Example case: 
MARY has building work done by JOHN. JOHN's email is compromised by fraudsters who send MARY payment request to be paid into an account who they say is under JOHNS name. MARY makes a bank transfer to the account and puts JOHN SMITH as Payee. Because the account number is correct the payment is accepted by the receiving bank. The actual account holder is JOE BLOG. Money is immediately withdrawn. The banks do not reimburse Mary.

attributes.action: Increase funds and awareness of homeless shelters for young people on our street
attributes.background: Homeless Youth are far too often stereotyped as dangerous troublemakers. Change is needed, as homeless youth need to be noticed. We need to provide food, water and shelter. We need your help to raise awareness, and end homelessness in Youth for good. Help our cause. #itcouldbeme.
attributes.additional_details:
We are part of the Jackman Team, National Citizen Service (NCS) The Challenge, Wave 11, Croydon. Over the past week we have planned a campaign to help homeless Youth in our area on Friday 26th August 2016 in Croydon town centre.
Abuse, money loss, family bereavement are all causes of our new generation becoming homeless. Do we really want the future to be on our streets? Help our cause. Sign our petition. Together, we can end Youth homelessness for good.

attributes.action: Legalise the age of buying and smoking e-juice to 14 with parental consent
attributes.background: Vaping and smoking e-juices do not harm kids! I'm 14 years old and I stopped smoking and moved onto e-juice. This is much less harmful then cigarettes and maybe more kids might stop smoking if the legal age was dropped.

attributes.action: Cap private rents at Local Housing Allowance (LHA) levels in England
attributes.background: LHAs are not typical of private rents. Those claiming Housing Benefit still have to top up their total rent from other benefits - often an impossible task, leading to rent arrears and crippling poverty. LHAs must be brought into line with actual private rents, or rents capped at the level of LHA.

attributes.action: Install Average Speed Cameras the entire length of the A34 in Oxfordshire
attributes.background:
As reported on national news the A34 has had over 50 deaths in the last 5 years, a significant factor being excessive speed.
There have been calls to reduce the speed limit to 50mph, but regardless of this - there must be robust enforcement, which only a full Average Speed Camera system can achieve
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-oxfordshire-36750468

attributes.action: Change E.S.A back to Incapacity benefit
attributes.background: I believe the current policies regarding ESA are wrong and unreasonable to the extent that the long term sick, are sick and not able to work, the decision to put the sick into work makes no sense as the illnesses are still there and there is no work for long term sufferers.

attributes.action: The UK should start a UN resolution to stop human right's violations in Myanmar
attributes.background: Myanmar security forces are violating the human right's of the Rohingya. Survivor accounts include crop destruction, rape, beatings and murder including children. The UK should use the security council seat to initiate a UN resolution to stop the crimes and give the UN full access or face sanctions.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see the UN OHCHR Flash Report:

http://www.ohchr.org/Documents/Countries/MM/FlashReport3Feb2017.pdf

attributes.action: Increase fines and ban cyclists from the road who jump red lights.
attributes.background:
It seems to becoming more apparent that cyclists in London and more recently Manchester are failing to stop at red lights, risking serious injuries to pedestrians.

The problem has also been increased by delivery companies using cyclists to deliver goods and failing to stop at red lights.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the Institute of Advanced Motorists, 57% of cyclists admit to running red lights. A 2013 YouGov poll found that 35% of cyclists admit to ignoring red lights at least “occasionally.”

If caught jumping a red light, cyclists can be issued a Fixed Penalty Notice of £30.

The Law is unfair. A motorist jumping a light,  will lead to a Fixed Penalty Notice of 3 points and £100 fine.

The same Law should  apply to cyclists who should also carry third party insurance as a minimum.

attributes.action: Make Childcare costs tax deductible for the self employed.
attributes.background: The self employed can't afford to take time off, not just financially. If you stop being available for work your clients find someone else, you fall behind industry trends and your skills get outdated. Child care to the self employed is a must have business expense and should be tax deductible.
attributes.additional_details:
Sole traders are at the forefront of UK business growth, According to the government’s department of business, Energy & Industrial Strategy in 2016 there were 4.2 million non-employing businesses  (which are basically businesses who do not employ anyone but the owner). They account for just under 76% of the overall business population. And 89% of the business population growth since 2000.

The self employed can not survive without child care and the UK can not survive without the self employed.

attributes.action: Ban petitions calling for a ban on visits by heads of state invited by UK Govt
attributes.background: The media is full of 'news' on petitions calling for heads of states which have been invited by the UK Government to visit to be banned from visiting. This is a waste of resources and time, obviously the UK Govt has deemed it right that these people are invited in the first place.

attributes.action: Make Enhanced DBS Checks a Legal Requirement for all MPs.
attributes.background: As a Health Professional I was surprised to learn that MPs, unlike other Public Servants in a position of trust, are not routinely required to have an Enhanced DBS check as a condition of their employment. MPs should be honest, trustworthy and above reproach, so background checks are reasonable.
attributes.additional_details:
I looked into background checks because the recent "Brexit" referendum raised doubts about the professional ethics and integrity of some of the MPs involved.

In 2014 North East MP Helen Goodman called for MPs to have "the same sort of checks as teachers and youth workers." As far as I'm aware this hasn't happened yet and is long overdue.

http://www.thejournal.co.uk/news/north-east-news/criminal-checks-needed-make-sure-7386465

attributes.action: Ensure that a trade deal with the EU is a priority over a trade deal with the US
attributes.background: The PM is discussing trade deals with the US, the party have given the impression that a trade deal with the US will be a substitute for the current trade deal with the European Union. Many jobs and business rely on the current EU trade deal and would gain no benefit from a trade deal with the USA.

attributes.action: To listen to the people and to trigger the article 50 so we can Brexit.
attributes.background: The people of England have spoken we need the article 50 to be triggered. We have voted for this country to be out of the EU.Therefore the government should listen to its people.
attributes.additional_details: We joined the EU for trading only NOT to be under their laws as suggested. We want democracy not to be the EU's puppets.

attributes.action: Create a register/database for any person who changes their name by deed poll
attributes.background:
The National Archives Government website states the following; 
"Contrary to popular belief, it has always been possible to change your name without having to register the change with any official body."
attributes.additional_details:
This hinders Police investigations, particularly when it comes to identity theft, sexual offences, bigamy, tax evasion and tracing missing persons. 
This petition is to request the creation of a database for all changes of name to be recorded on a register similar to that of the Births, Deaths and Marriages. Any persons who wish to not be included on this register must make an application detailing their reasons for the removal which must be authorised by an appropriate person.

attributes.action: Make all commuting via public transport tax-deductible.
attributes.background: Give Tax Relief to all commuters who use public transport to travel to and from their permanent place of work.  This would help reduce the cost of living to the average uk citizen and be better for the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
The employer buys the ticket and money is removed direct from the employees pay packet before tax is calculated. 
This may encourage less people to use cars which is better for the environment.  It can be managed online to reduce administration costs.
